answers.c: Open circuit and short circuit current
answers.d: Neither open circuit nor short circuit current

explanations.a: Norton current is obtained by shorting the specified terminals. So, it is the short circuit current. It is not the open circuit current because if specified terminals get open circuited then current is equal to zero.

answers.c: Shorting all voltage sources and opening all current sources
answers.d: Opening all voltage sources and shorting all current sources

explanations.c: Ideal current sources have infinite internal resistance hence behave like an open circuit whereas ideal voltage sources have zero internal resistances hence behave as a short circuit. So, to obtain Norton resistance, all voltage sources are shorted and all current sources are opened.

answers.d: Neither linear networks nor non-linear networks
